did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, newspapers, printed material, memorabilia, legal documents, photographs.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Papers from the family of Alonzo Cornell and his son, Charles Ezra and daughter-in-law, Katherine Bouck.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Papers from the family of Alonzo Cornell and his son, Charles Ezra and daughter-in-law, Katherine Bouck.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell-Bouck Family Papers, #8502. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

emph.ref: Series I. Alonzo B. Cornell Materials
Series III. Cornell Family Documents and Materials

scopecontent.p: Includes letters from H. Bronson and Margaret
Includes letters from Otis E. Wood, A. Oakey Hall, DH Craig, and Colonel John C. Fremont
Includes letters from G. Schuyler, D. Boardman, Thomas Faile Jr., HB Lord, O. Wood, WC Curran, and Alfred Wells
Includes letters from John Meredith Read, Friedrich Schuk, Judge Folger, J. Selkreg, G. Schuyler, D. Boardman, Thomas Strong, GC Caldwell, Wesley Hooker, and Edward Underhill
Letter from Horace Greeley
Includes letters from William Bogardt and James Blaine,
Includes letters from WW Astor, JB Foraker, Stewart Woodford, Albert Shaw, William Bogardt, and B. Lucy
Includes letters from Crane, Elijah Coffue, and Mayor of NY
Includes letters from the President's secretary, Mayor of NY, Charles Hughes, and Jacob Gould Schurman,

did.unittitle: Letters and notes from Civil War soldiers
Letters regarding New York State politics

scopecontent.p: Includes letters from D. Boardman, O. Sawyer, Horace Greeley, Jas. Terwilliger, T. Platt, Charles Cook, and William S. Lincoln
Includes letters from Jas. Terwilliger
Includes letters from Oliver Hurd, DS Bennett, OW Chapman, JS Thurston, George Otis, JH Selkreg, GW Schuyler, R. Sidney, Charles K. Graham, and several others
Discusses possible appointment of Alonzo Cornell to his cabinet
Describes living with Abraham Lincoln and his impressions

did.unittitle: Letters regarding early days of the telegraph

scopecontent.p: Includes some outgoing correspondence

did.unittitle: Letter from Elijah Cornell to Alonzo, with Elijah's will
Letters to Mary Ann and Ezra Cornell
Outgoing letters, mainly to family members
Letters to Mary Ann and Ezra Cornell
Letters to Mary Ann and Ezra Cornell
Letters to Mary Ann and Ezra Cornell
Letters to Mary Ann and Ezra Cornell
Letters to Mary Ann and Ezra Cornell
Letters to Mary Ann and Ezra Cornell
Letters to Mary Ann and Ezra Cornell
Letters to Mary Ann and Ezra Cornell
Letters to Mary Ann and Ezra Cornell

scopecontent.p: Includes letter about building the library

did.unittitle: Letters to Mary Ann and Ezra Cornell

scopecontent.p: Includes letters to Gov. Fenton, Charles Cornell, and the bank

did.unittitle: "Life of Ezra Cornell", by Alonzo Cornell, original manuscript
"Recognition by the United States of Foreign Powers", by Alonzo Cornell
Alonzo's telegraph abbreviation notebook with clippings
Fall Creek deed, sketches, and maps
Alonzo Cornell and Lucius Colby contract
Petition from Binghamton to State Senate, regarding stockholders and offices
Promissory notes, Alonzo and Ezra Cornell
Alonzo Cornell and Virgil Blauchard contract, and contract with TD Wilcox
Letters from AD White to Mrs Alonzo Cornell
Letters from Jacob Gould Schurman to Mrs. Alonzo Cornell
Clippings and articles collected in scrapbook by Alonzo Cornell

scopecontent.p: Includes letters from Jay Gould, Mary Ann Cornell, Goldwin Smith, Stewart Woodford, James Law, and William Russell

did.unittitle: Letters from GF Lewis, land warrant broker
Letters from Henry Sage to Ezra Cornell
Letters from AD White, regarding the purchase of the cast collection
Typescripts, with edits and notes, and photostats of letters from Ezra Cornell to his wife Mary Ann Cornell
Old folders with descriptions of letters from Ezra to Alonzo and Mary Ann

scopecontent.p: Includes letter from March, 1861 describing Mr. and Mrs. Lincoln, in folder 11

did.unittitle: Letters to Horace Greeley regarding St. Croix land grant
Letter to Governor from OEW, transcribed by EEC
Typed story of Cornell and the Telegraph
Souvenir coin given to Ezra by the mayor of New York City on the opening of the Erie Canal. In a wooden box made from wood shipped on the first boat to go through the canals
Signed petition from Binghamton to Ezra
Appeal book for the settlement of Ezra Cornell's estate
Hand-written biography of Ezra Cornell, written on the back of 1892 Ithaca Building Co. printouts
Series III. Cornell Family Documents and Materials
Letter from Charles to Frank Cornell
Letters and documents to Charles regarding New York State agriculture

scopecontent.p: Includes letters from Alonzo Cornell and Orrin Wood
Includes letters from Cuthbert Pound, Charles Hughes, and Herbert Lehman

did.unittitle: Letters from George and Inez Fields
Map of Africa from Charles's room
State of New York Attorney and Counsellor certificate
Union University Albany Law School bachelor diploma
Copies of engraving of Alonzo Cornell
Marriage service, William B. Cornell and Emily
Two daily diaries, one from Charles Cornell, one unknown
Rocks from Pompeii, sand from where St. Peter was martyred, bullet from Saratoga battlefield, and buttons from a US Uniform
Letter from Elijah Cornell to his wife
DR Wood letter to Mary Ann Cornell
Cayuga Lake operatim of boats, passenger fares etc.
Deeds and mortgages, James Covert, Katherine and Charles Cornell
Letter to Franklin Cornell from Thomas Rooker
"History of the Class of Seventy Nine of Columbia College", written by the historian
Photograph of clocks possibly made by Ithaca Calendar Clock Co, and article about Alonzo Cornell clock story
Note regarding the commission of the Ezra Cornell portrait
Highway route certification, Town of Fulton
Letter from the White House to William B, Cornell
William B. Cornell stock information from Yervan Maxudian
Inventory of books, including correspondence with book dealers
Letters to Cornell University regarding gift of William B. Cornell
Katherine B. Cornell shares, application for "Daughters of the Revolution"
Benjamin Wood genealogy, and miscellaneous genealogies
Photograph of the house on the corner of Seneca and Tioga street, Ithaca, where Ezra Cornell died.
Velvet pin cushion given by William B. Cornell to his mother
William B. Cornell American Society of Mechanical Engineers member certificate
William B. Cornell The University of the State of New York license to practice engineering
William B. Cornell Institute of Management certificate
Certification of election to NY State Senate
Certificates of appointments as sheriff, assemblyman, and military positions
Agreement between Peter Hoes and WC Bouck
Letters regarding bank practices, from D. Beckman
Letters regarding the California gold rush
Part of the card case of William Bouck's wife
Map of Schoharie Valley showing route traversed by Colonel Sir John Johnson in 1780 raid
Signature of William Pauck, scripture leaves
Infantry appointments for Christyan Bauck, Joseph Bouck
Agreement on sale of a slave
Certification of V. Danforth as Physician and Surgeon
Letter from Charles Bouck to father
Transcript of the Account of William Bouck
Charles Bouck, made member of the town war committee
Letter from Francis Bouck to Mrs. Charles Bouck
